channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump to Announce Additional $100 Billion Apple Investment in U.S.
item.description: The pledge was a “significant acceleration” of the company’s plan for more production in the United States, according to a White House statement.

item.title: The ultra-wealthy expect hotel-level amenities for their homes—and developers are racing to keep up
item.description: A simple pool and gym aren’t enough to attract wealthy residents anymore.

item.title: Stanford Newspaper Challenges Legal Basis for Student Deportations
item.description: A new lawsuit brought by a First Amendment watchdog group argues that the use of a rarely invoked immigration law to target pro-Palestinian demonstrat...

item.title: Spending on AI data centers is so massive that it’s now two-thirds of GDP—and it could crash the American economy
item.description: As Rusty Foster, author of the widely read media blog Today in Tabs, puts it: "our economy might just be three AI data centers in a trench coat."

item.title: A bright spot for Tesla shareholders: Under Elon Musk’s new $27 comp package, their fate is now intertwined with his
item.description: If shareholders suffer over the next five years, so will Musk.

item.title: AI is gutting workforces—and an ex-Google exec says CEOs are too busy ‘celebrating’ their efficiency gains to see they’re next
item.description: Google’s former chief business officer Mo Gawdat says that the notion AI will create jobs is ‘100% crap’. He warns it’ll wipe out jobs, with even ‘inc...

item.title: Wildfire In Wet Washington State Is Changing Under Climate Change
item.description: The famously rainy state is facing longer, hotter and drier fire seasons, raising the risk of a mammoth fire that will be nearly impossible to fight. ...

item.title: Fearing tariff-induced price hikes, parents are back-to-school shopping earlier than any year on record
item.description: More than two-thirds of families started buying pencils, pens, paper and folders in early July.

item.title: Prince Harry Cleared of Bullying Accusations at Charity He Co-founded
item.description: The British regulator found no evidence to support the claims made by the charity’s chair, but it criticized all sides for letting the fight play out ...

item.title: War Shattered His Face. Technology Helped Reconstruct It.

item.title: After Weeks of Sectarian Clashes in Syria, an Uneasy Truce Takes Hold
item.description: The fighting has stopped in the southern city of Sweida, three weeks after a deadly eruption of violence. But the area remains tense as clashes contin...

item.title: Donald Trump and John Roberts Have a Lot in Common
item.description: The Supreme Court may extinguish a law that more than any other made the promise of American democracy a reality.

item.title: Sudan’s Civil War Shifts Toward Kordofan
